member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Degrees
member.summary: ('deg') Degrees. There are 360 degrees in a full circle.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Gradians
member.summary: ('grad') Gradians, also known as "gons" or "grades". There are 400 gradians in a full circle.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Radians
member.summary: ('rad') Radians. There are 2 radians in a full circle.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Turn
member.summary: ('turn') Turns. There is 1 turn in a full circle.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Seconds
member.summary: ('s') Seconds.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Milliseconds
member.summary: ('ms') Milliseconds. There are 1000 milliseconds in a second.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Hertz
member.summary: ('Hz') Hertz. It represents the number of occurrences per second.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.KiloHertz
member.summary: ('kHz') KiloHertz. A kiloHertz is 1000 Hertz.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.Percent
member.summary: ('%') Varies based on which style property it's being used with.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.EM
member.summary: ('em') Relative to the font size of the element.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.EX
member.summary: ('ex') X-height of the elements font.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.CAP
member.summary: ('cap') Relative to the cap height (the nominal height of capital letters) of the elements font.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.CH
member.summary: ('ch') Relative to the average character advance of a narrow glyph in the elements font, as represented by the 0 (ZERO, U+0030) glyph.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.IC
member.summary: ('ic') Relative to the average character advance of a fullwidth glyph in the elements font, as represented by the (CJK water ideograph, U+6C34) glyph.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.REM
member.summary: ('rem') Relative to the font size of the root element.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.LineHeight
member.summary: ('lh') Relative to the line height of the element.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.RootLineHeight
member.summary: ('rlh') Relative to the line height of the root element.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.ViewWidth
member.summary: ('vw') Equal to 1% of the width of the initial containing block.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.ViewHeight
member.summary: ('vh') Equal to 1% of the height of the initial containing block.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.ViewInline
member.summary: ('vi') Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block in the direction of the root elements inline axis.

member.name: F:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Css.CssUnit.ViewBlock
member.summary: ('vb') Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block in the direction of the root elements block axis.

member.summary: The body of the promise. Supports the following 'default' tokens: {resolve} - To resolve the promise (need to call with paranthesis IE: {resolve}(23) will resolve 23). {reject} - To reject the promise need to call with paranthesis IE: {reject}(43) will reject and pass the value 43). {args} - To refer to the arguments array of the intial function. * Attempting to reference the arguments object by name in the script will return the promises arguments and not what was passed in.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.BaseElement.Clear
member.summary: Clears the content of this element.
member.remarks: If this element is a text entry element, the method will clear the value. It has no effect on other elements. Text entry elements are defined as elements with INPUT or TEXTAREA tags.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.BaseElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.

remarks.para: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined. behavior.
If this element is not clickable, then this operation is ignored. This allows you to simulate a users to accidentally missing the target when clicking.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.BaseElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element: Attribute nameValue returned if not explicitly specifiedValid element types
checkedcheckedCheck Box
selectedselectedOptions in Select elements
disableddisabledInput and other UI elements

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.BaseElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.
